result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:44 AM Defendant Mackenzie J A Keipe in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like an attorney. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Was given forms for court appointed attorney. Case will be recalled. 9:45/ 9:57 AM  Appearances the same. Court found the defendant indigent. Appointed attorney Mark Lawton. He is to pay $100/hr. starting 11/1/22.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Return date scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for a pretrial conference 9/16/22 at 9:50 A.M. and return date 9/29/22 at 9:00 A.M.
standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia

Defendant Mackenzie J A Keipe appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Claire Edwards. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $2,000.00 sign bond, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, waives time limits to prelim,
